intro: Chanekia coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. Chanekia coriacea is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
